macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Market Edges Higher Amid AI and Economic Concerns
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.1% to 6,843.22, the Dow Jones gained 0.1% to 49,553.19, and the Nasdaq composite added 0.1% to 22,578.38 on Tuesday. Markets experienced significant volatility as companies reported weak consumer confidence and tech stocks faced pressure from AI-related concerns.

items.title: AI Uncertainty Replaces Tariff Concerns as Primary Market Driver
items.summary: Uncertainty about artificial intelligence has become the dominant factor influencing stock market movements in 2026, with the VIX volatility index rising to 20.24 from 14.95 at year-end 2025. Investors are reassessing which companies could be winners or losers in an AI-transformed economy.

items.title: Tech Stocks Decline as AI Boom Concerns Intensify
items.summary: Major tech stocks including Alphabet fell 1.2% as investors rotated away from companies potentially threatened by AI disruption. Nvidia showed volatility, swinging between being a market strength and weakness.

items.title: Consumer Confidence Weakens Amid Inflation and Labor Market Concerns
items.summary: Recent surveys indicate declining household confidence as consumers struggle with inflation above desired levels, weak job market growth, and tariff-related worries. This sentiment is weighing on market performance.

items.title: Nvidia to Report Q4 Fiscal 2026 Results on February 25
items.summary: AI bellwether Nvidia is scheduled to report its fourth-quarter fiscal 2026 earnings on February 25, with investors closely watching the company's performance amid broader AI sector uncertainty.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: World Liberty Forum Crypto Conference Held at Mar-a-Lago
items.summary: A major crypto asset conference hosted by World Liberty Financial took place at President Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence, drawing approximately 400 attendees including crypto executives, politicians, and bank chiefs. The event featured speakers such as Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong and investor Kevin O'Leary, though it has drawn criticism over potential conflicts of interest.

items.title: Bitcoin Struggles Near $68,000 Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading around $68,356, struggling to stay above $70,000 as the crypto market faces selling pressure and macro headwinds. Early February saw Bitcoin plunge to $63,295 before rebounding above $70,000 on February 6th, marking its largest single-day gain since March 2023.

items.title: Bitcoin Down Over 20% in Q1 2026, Weakest Quarter in Eight Years
items.summary: Bitcoin has declined more than 20% in the first quarter of 2026, putting it on track for its weakest start to a year since 2018. Despite strong corporate buying accumulating over 1 million BTC in the past 18 months, price momentum has stalled near $68,000.

items.title: Fed Chair Nominee Kevin Warsh Weighs on Crypto Sentiment
items.summary: President Trump's selection of Kevin Warsh as Federal Reserve chair nominee has pressured crypto markets, as analysts view him as less dovish than expected, raising concerns about tighter monetary conditions that negatively impact speculative assets.

items.title: Crypto Stocks Decline Alongside Bitcoin, COIN Shows Recovery Signs
items.summary: Crypto mining and exchange stocks have been hit harder than cryptocurrencies themselves due to their reliance on high crypto prices. However, Coinbase (COIN) beat analyst estimates in recent earnings and bounced off its lowest price in two years, potentially signaling sector recovery.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NDTV IND.AI Summit Inaugurated in New Delhi
items.summary: India hosts its inaugural NDTV IND.AI Summit on February 18, 2026, bringing together global AI leaders including representatives from OpenAI, Google, and UC Berkeley to discuss AI's role in governance, economic strategy, and international policy frameworks.

items.title: AI Model Risk Management Market Projected to Reach $10.5 Billion by 2029
items.summary: The global AI Model Risk Management Market is expected to grow at a 12.9% compound annual growth rate, driven by increasing demand for automated risk assessment, bias detection, and compliance monitoring across AI systems.

items.title: Data Science Salon Rebrands to AI Loves Data
items.summary: Data Science Salon, a vendor-neutral community for AI and data science professionals, officially rebrands to AI Loves Data (ALD) on February 18, 2026, marking its 10-year anniversary and reflecting the industry's evolution.

items.title: Ramco Systems Launches Chia Enterprise Conversational AI Agent
items.summary: Ramco Systems introduces Chia, an enterprise-grade conversational AI agent designed to improve customer experience across business operations.

items.title: Federal Reserve Examines AI's Impact on Labor Market
items.summary: Federal Reserve Governor Michael S. Barr discusses how agentic AI systems capable of complex task automation could significantly reshape employment across professional and service sectors in 2026.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 in Late February
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass is receiving a new batch of games in late February 2026, with Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 as the headline addition.

items.title: U.S. Video Game Industry Spending Projected to Reach $62.8B in 2026
items.summary: Circana projects U.S. video game spending will rise 3% to $62.8 billion in 2026, surpassing the previous all-time high of $61.7 billion set in 2021.

items.title: Rewind 99 Launches Free Steam Demo Ahead of Steam Next Fest
items.summary: Rewind 99, a chaotic video rental store management game, released a free Steam demo on February 18 in advance of Steam Next Fest.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Atomic Arcade Studio
items.summary: Hasbro has shut down its Atomic Arcade studio, though the company states its in-development G.I. Joe 'Snake Eyes' game remains active.

items.title: NVIDIA RTX 50 Series Bundle Includes Resident Evil Requiem
items.summary: NVIDIA is offering Resident Evil Requiem as a bundled game with purchases of the GeForce RTX 50 Series graphics cards.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
